Create a System Security Profile

A system security profile is configured for the access network. Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) is used as a backhaul solution to provide authentication and manage security certificates within a service provider network so that data and voice traffic can be transmitted securely.

PKI consists of policies, procedures, and roles for authentication that use public key cryptography. The PKI infrastructure is used to request, install, configure, manage, and revoke digital certificates. PKI offers the End Entity (EE) client and authentication through digital certificates that are signed and provided by a Certification Authority (CA) for devices within the operator domain. PKI uses the Certificate Management Protocol (CMPv2) to provide access network devices with X.509 digital certificate enrollment, renewal, and status verification using a Certificate Request. These processes are described in more detail in RFC 4210 and RFC 4211 respectively.

  • Configure a PKI Security Profile
    Use this task to create a system security profile which includes the PKI certificate parameters required for server authentication.
Parent topic: Configure Device System Profiles
